channel.title: NPR Topics: Culture
channel.description: Art and entertainment commentary plus interviews, book reviews, movie reviews, music reviews, comedy, and visual art. Subscribe to podcasts and follow trends in music, painting, art, architecture, photography, and design.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: 'Rental Family' star Brendan Fraser discusses his lifelong search for belonging
item.description: In his new film, Fraser plays an actor in Tokyo who takes a job with a rental family service. It's based on a real phenomenon in Japan: companies where you can hire someone to fill a gap in your life.
item.content:encoded: In his new film, Fraser plays an actor in Tokyo who takes a job with a rental family service. It's based on a real phenomenon in Japan: companies where you can hire someone to fill a gap in your life.
item.dc:creator: Tonya Mosley

item.title: Here are the Books We Love: 380+ great 2025 reads recommended by NPR
item.description: Our annual reading guide returns with 380+ new titles handpicked by NPR staff and trusted critics. Find 13 years of recommendations all in one place — that's more than 4,000 great reads.
item.content:encoded: Our annual reading guide returns with 380+ new titles handpicked by NPR staff and trusted critics. Find 13 years of recommendations all in one place — that's more than 4,000 great reads.
item.dc:creator: Beth Novey

item.title: Gather 'round the table — it's time for a 'Family Feast!'
item.description: Big Ma dashes off commands, pots clang, aunts and uncles shoot the breeze, little ones beg to lick the bowl, ham and candied yam. Family Feast! is about food, family and love.
item.content:encoded: Big Ma dashes off commands, pots clang, aunts and uncles shoot the breeze, little ones beg to lick the bowl, ham and candied yam. Family Feast! is about food, family and love.
item.dc:creator: Samantha Balaban

item.title: Sunday Puzzle: Opposite homophones
item.description: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with WVXU listener Dennis Pattinson of Cincinnati, Ohio and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ayesha Rascoe plays the puzzle with WVXU listener Dennis Pattinson of Cincinnati, Ohio and Weekend Edition Puzzlemaster Will Shortz.
item.dc:creator: Will Shortz

item.title: 'Wait Wait' for November 22, 2025: With Not My Job guests Niki Russ Federman and Josh Russ Tupper
item.description: This week, Wait Wait is live in Chicago with host Peter Sagal, special guests Niki Russ Federman and Josh Russ Tupper, and panelists Joyelle Nicole Johnson, Zach Zimmerman, and Faith Salie
item.content:encoded:
This week, Wait Wait is live in Chicago with host Peter Sagal, special guests Niki Russ Federman and Josh Russ Tupper, and panelists Joyelle Nicole Johnson, Zach Zimmerman, and Faith Salie  

(Image credit: Dani Case)

item.title: These fans have sung their way to the National Women's Soccer League finals
item.description: The Washington Spirit takes on Gotham FC on Saturday in San Jose, Calif.
item.content:encoded:
The Washington Spirit takes on Gotham FC on Saturday in San Jose, Calif.

(Image credit: Luke Chávez)
item.dc:creator: Chloe Veltman

item.title: Main Character of the Week: Reaction to Rini
item.description: NPR's Mia Venkat explains what the internet was obsessed with this week.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Mia Venkat explains what the internet was obsessed with this week.
item.dc:creator: Mia Venkat

item.title: Senate Democrats are investigating the Kennedy Center for 'cronyism, corruption'
item.description: Senate Democrats say the new Kennedy Center leadership has led to "millions in lost revenue, luxury spending, and preferential treatment for Trump allies." The performing arts center denies the allegations.
item.content:encoded:
Senate Democrats say the new Kennedy Center leadership has led to "millions in lost revenue, luxury spending, and preferential treatment for Trump allies." The performing arts center denies the allegations.

(Image credit: The John F. Kennedy Center for the Performing Arts)
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Blair

item.title: A new Miss Universe is crowned, weeks after she left a pageant event in protest
item.description: This year's Miss Universe competition, held in Bangkok, was marred by a series of dramatic incidents, from a contestant's livestreamed walkout to a now former judge's allegations of rigging.
item.content:encoded:
This year's Miss Universe competition, held in Bangkok, was marred by a series of dramatic incidents, from a contestant's livestreamed walkout to a now former judge's allegations of rigging.

(Image credit: Lillian Suwanrumpha)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: Shakespeare's unhappy marriage takes center stage in 'Hamnet'
item.description: A new film, adapted from Maggie O'Farrell's 2020 novel, posits that the death of Shakespeare's 11-year-old son may have inspired one of the greatest fictional tragedies ever written.
item.content:encoded: A new film, adapted from Maggie O'Farrell's 2020 novel, posits that the death of Shakespeare's 11-year-old son may have inspired one of the greatest fictional tragedies ever written.
item.dc:creator: Justin Chang
